intro: Persoonia scabrella, commonly known as the rough-leaved geebung, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody shrub form. The leaves are typically narrow, rough, and often covered in fine hairs, giving the plant its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale yellow or greenish in color. Persoonia scabrella is adapted to grow in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions.
